title: Version mismatch error in WSL even though versions are the same
body:
Version mismatch error in WSL even though versions are the same

### Vagrant version
Vagrant versions on both windows and WSL 1.9.6. I can't use 1.9.7 because of #8900

### Host operating system
Windows 10 and WSL ubuntu 16.04

### Expected behavior
Help text displayed

### Actual behavior
Got error about version mismatch

### Steps to reproduce

```
$ which vagrant
/usr/bin/vagrant
$ which vagrant.exe
/mnt/c/vagrant/bin/vagrant.exe
$ vagrant version
Installed Version: 1.9.6
Latest Version: 1.9.7

To upgrade<....>

$ vagrant.exe version
Unable to translate current working directory. Using C:\WINDOWS\system32
Installed Version: 1.9.6
Latest Version: 1.9.7

To upgrade<....>

$ export VAGRANT_WSL_ENABLE_WINDOWS_ACCESS="1"
$ vagrant
Vagrant cannot currently enable access to manage machines within the Windows
environment because the version of Vagrant installed on Windows does not
match this version of Vagrant running within the Windows Subsystem for Linux.
Please ensure both installation of Vagrant are the same. If you do not want
update your Vagrant installations you can disable Windows access by unsetting
the `VAGRANT_WSL_ACCESS_WINDOWS_USER` environment variable.

  Windows Vagrant version: 1.9.6
  Windows Subsystem for Linux Vagrant version: 1.9.6

```

Note that error text even displays the same version
